work.description: An Alien. Guy for everything. My work begin from contacting a potential client, negotiate, make a deal and start working on it. That means analyze a client's needs, find a suitable solution for him, develop and deliver it. After that, maintain it and be ready for everything

I was a member of small development team. My job was to provide maintenance of their intranet systems, written in PHP, generate DB reports for sales department (using Microsoft SSRS / SSIS platform or by direct DB query), debugging, error tracking and fixing.
Building a custom intranet solutions for our clients. My role was to analyze client's needs and develop a solution for him. From analyze through model, develop to testing and deploying.
This company is my Father's firm. I'm providing him the whole IT background support

volunteer.description: IAESTE stands for The International Association for the Exchange of Students for Technical Experience. IAESTE is an student organization. It's managed and developed by students, who decided to be proactive during their study. I matured from a member to IT Leader with nationwide responsibility for our IT systems and IT teamwork

projects.name: Life Art
projects.description: For my client I have designed a modern, clean and responsive layout as her new web identity. I speed up the development process with Bootstrap Grid, LESS and Gulp with server refresh

projects.name: Studio V/A
projects.description: My friend needed a reservation system for his gym, where he's doing group trainings. So I developed a custom solution for his needs, written in PHP Nette Framework, MySQL database and Bootstrap HTML/CSS frontend. System is connected to invoice system API (Billdu)

education.faculty: Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology

technologies.name: Unix, Bash

technologies.name: HTML/CSS
technologies.description: Building responsive websites with Twitter Bootstrap or Zurb Foundation CSS frameworks. In these days I compose styles with SCSS preprocessor and strip all the unnecessary SCSS modules from Bootstrap/Foundation, except Grid system, and do the rest by my own.

technologies.description: For a long time I've been developing websites with PHP. Using MVC architecture pattern, Composer, Dependency Injection and Propel ORM I was able to create a robust and maintainable applications

technologies.description: With proper CI/CD and Github Workflow I can rapidly speed up my development process, from 'git push' to run all tests and finally stage/deploy. Using Gitlab CI tools and AWS infrastructure
